text: India has more names for complexion than Eskimos do for snow. (Guessing it's all a little more unstated in -- for instance -- Brazil.)
It's about the responsibility of industrialization for socio-political degeneration.

"Lena Edlund ... and Cecilia Machado ... estimate that the diffusion of [mobile] phones could explain 19 to 29 percent of the decline in homicides seen from 1990 to 2000." theatlantic.com/technology/a…?
"We need to stop wringing our hands over how to save academia and acknowledge that its disease is terminal." quillette.com/2019/05/09/aft…

... "... we need to ... recreate institutions that route around the modern variant of education so that it can expire peacefully — or, at least, shrink enormously — without dragging us all down with it."
